page.title: 04Kington St Michael
page.content: The village is three miles north of Chippenham,and two miles south-west of Junction 17 on the{M4 Motorway. It has one main street which is quite straight. It is about half a mile long from one end to the other. This main street is simply called Kington St.Michael. The name Kington comes from the fact that this area of land once belonged to the King. In Saxon times there is a record that{King {Athelstan,}in 943 A.D., gave a parcel of land called Kington to one of his officers called Atheline. Some time later, between 1235 and 1253, Michael of Amesbury,who was then Abbot of{Glastonbury,}had the Church re-dedicated to his name saint, St. Michael. This is how the village got its full name of Kington St.Michael.
